question: 日本酒
sourceMnemonic: You know that <ja>日本</ja> is "Japan" so when you add <kanji>alcohol</kanji> onto the end of that you have <vocabulary>Japanese Style Alcohol</vocabulary> (what's the big Japanese style alcohol that everyone knows? That's <vocabulary>sake</vocabulary>).
sourceReadingMnemonic:
The reading is just the vocab <ja>日本</ja>'s reading plus the reading you learned for <ja>酒</ja>, put together.

The alternative reading <ja>にっぽんしゅ</ja> is really rare, but you might come across its abbreviated version <ja>ぽん酒</ja>, or <ja>ポン酒</ja>.
